tools: {@item Disguise kit|PHB} and one {@item musical instrument}

default: (a) a {@item whip|PHB} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a set of {@item fine clothes|PHB} or (b) {@item costume clothes|PHB|costume}
(a) an {@item entertainer's pack|PHB} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|PHB}
{@item leather armor|PHB|Leather armor}, a set of {@item Traveler's Clothes|PHB}, a {@item disguise kit|PHB}, a {@item Perfume (vial)|PHB|vial of perfume}, and a {@item dagger|PHB}

classFeature.name: Break a Leg
entries: You can add your proficiency bonus to your initiative rolls and when you roll for initiative, you can use your reaction to grant a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you advantage on the first attack roll or ability check it makes before the end of its next turn.
Additionally, when you dance as a part of making a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check, you are considered proficient with the skill and you can add your Dexterity modifier to the check.

classFeature.name: Dance Flares
entries: You can use an action to captivate your audience with your enthusiasm, grace, and force of personality, performing a dazzling flare to support allies and distract foes.

entries.name: Flares Known
entries: You learn three {@filter Flares|optionalfeatures|feature type=DF|source=TPDanc} of your choice, detailed at the end of the class description. When you reach certain dancer levels, you learn additional flares of your choice, as shown in the Flares Known column of the Dancer table. When you gain a level in this class, you can replace a flare you know with a different one.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If a flare requires your target to make a saving throw to resist its effects, the saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Feather Step
entries: While you are not wearing medium or heavy armor or wielding a shield, your speed increases by 10 feet and you can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on your turn.
When you take the Disengage action, moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement for the turn and you don't set off traps by walking on them.

classFeature.name: Step Up
entries: You can use your action to perform an invigorating dance that enlivens your audience. When you do, choose one creature that can see you within 30 feet of you. The creature can immediately move up to half its speed and take one action, treating it as an action it would take on its turn. Afterwords, that creature can't benefit from this feature again until the end of its next turn.

classFeature.name: Dancer's Choreo
entries: You define your style of dancing, your Dancer's Choreo. Your choreo grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 17th levels.

entries.name: Choreo Flares
entries: Each choreo has a signature dance flare, detailed in its feature. Choreo flares don't count against your number of flares known.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Double Time
entries: You can perform a {@filter Dance Flare|optionalfeatures|feature type=DF|source=TPDanc} as a bonus action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Dancer's Choreo feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain one feature granted by your Dancer's Choreo.

classFeature.name: Endless Stamina
entries: Your movement speed can't be reduced by exhaustion and, whenever you finish a short rest, your exhaustion level, if any, is decreased by 1 if you aren't dehydrated or starving.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Your poise allows you to stylishly avoid certain area effects, such as an ancient black dragon's acid breath or a {@spell call lightning } spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Don't Stop Me Now
entries: Your speed increases by an additional 10 feet and, when you make a contested check or saving throw against being {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition stunned}, you can make a Dexterity saving throw instead of the check or saving throw called for in the effect.

classFeature.name: Call and Response
entries: When a creature misses you with an attack, you can use your reaction to perform a {@filter Dance Flare|optionalfeatures|feature type=DF|source=TPDanc}.

classFeature.name: Dancer's Choreo feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain one feature granted by your Dancer's Choreo.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Allegro
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Step Up|Dancer|TPDanc|2} feature on a creature, each of your and the target's speeds increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Force of Personality
entries: You have been instilled with a fervor for captivating audiences. You can add your Charisma modifier to the damage you deal with {@filter Dance Flare|optionalfeatures|feature type=DF|source=TPDanc}, and to saving throws you make against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, and against spells that would cause you to act against your will through mental manipulation (such as the {@spell command} spell).

classFeature.name: Rondo
entries: When you use {@classFeature Step Up|Dancer|TPDanc|2}, you can perform a {@filter Dance Flare|optionalfeatures|feature type=DF|source=TPDanc} as a part of the same action.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Dancer's Choreo feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain one feature granted by your Dancer's Choreo.

classFeature.name: Elusive
entries: You are so hard to pin-down that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Encore
entries: If the target of your {@classFeature Step Up|Dancer|TPDanc|2} feature rolls a 20 on the d20 for the action you grant them with {@classFeature Step Up|Dancer|TPDanc|2}, they can take one additional action.

subclassFeature.name: Bladed Bravo
entries: Masters of blade, spear, whip, and staff, dancers of this choreo blend artistic grace and martial prowess to put on breathtaking displays that are as beautiful as they are deadly. Their performances call for more than just raw strength or speed, but precision and control of both one's weapon and body, with dancers often showing how well they can dodge a weapon as well as wield one.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Arts
entries: You gain proficiency with medium armor and martial weapons that have the finesse property. You can still benefit from your Feather Step feature while wearing medium armor.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if a feature lets you choose again.

subclassFeature.name: Choreo Flare: Saber Dance
entries: You learn the {@optfeature Saber Dance|TPDanc} flare, detailed at the end of this class, which doesn't count against the number of flares you know. While other dancers might use weapons in their dances, this choreo specializes in this flare. Your attacks with Saber Dance score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
Further, if an enemy provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can perform Saber Dance as the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Dancing Blade
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one melee weapon that you are proficient with and that lacks the twohanded or heavy properties. The weapon becomes a dancing blade imbued with a facsimile of life until it is reduced to 0 hit points, you die, or you use this feature again. It is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands.

In combat, the dancing blade shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you command it to take another action as a bonus action or as a part of performing your Saber Dance flare. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the dancing blade can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

subclassFeature.name: Fluid Momentum
entries: If you perform {@optfeature Saber Dance|TPDanc} as an opportunity attack, you can make two attacks with it, rather than one.
Further, you have advantage on attack rolls you make as a reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Dazzling Destruction
entries: Your attacks with Saber Dance score a critical hit on a roll of 18–20.

subclassFeature.name: Danse Macabre
entries: This choreo's choreography is modeled upon necromantic rituals, embracing death as a "beautiful curtain call to the performance of life." But what's a legendary performance without an encore? Dancers of the Grim Fandango are able to raise and command their own dance troupe of undead.

subclassFeature.name: Choreo Flare: Thriller
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Thriller|TPDanc} flare, detailed below. It does not count against the number of flares you know.

subclassFeature.name: Necromantic Arts
entries: You gain the {@spell chill touch} and {@spell corpselight|TPDanc} cantrips. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
Further, if you deal necrotic damage to a creature, you can spend one of your Hit Dice to gain temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifer.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Fandango
entries: You can have a number of undead under your control with your {@optfeature Thriller|TPDanc} flare equal to half your proficiency bonus, round up.
Additionally, any undead you raise through {@optfeature Thriller|TPDanc} add your proficiency bonus to their weapon damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Giving Up the Ghost
entries: You can dance upon the Border Ethereal while you move, allowing you and any equipment you are wearing or carrying to move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside an object, you take 1d10 force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Beauty Beyond the Grave
entries: You can perform your {@optfeature Thriller|TPDanc} flare to enthrall anything without a pulse. When an undead within 60 feet of you can see you perform {@optfeature Thriller|TPDanc}, it must make a Charisma saving throw against your flare save DC. If it succeeds on this saving throw or any subsequent saves, you can't use this feature on it again. If it fails, if becomes friendly to you and obeys your commands until you use this feature again.

Intelligent undead are harder to control in this way. If the target has an Intelligence of 8 or higher, it has advantage on the saving throw. If it fails the saving throw and has an Intelligence of 12 or higher, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour until it succeeds and breaks free.

subclassFeature.name: Idolized Superstar
entries: Some are born destined for fame, others work their fingers to the bone daily to achieve it, some are just in the right place at the right time. From these individuals, the choreo of the Idolized Superstar was born. Ever the center of public attention, most students of this Choreo live in the public's eye, soaking in the adulation of their adoring fans. Once famous, some take to adopting a secret persona or alter ego, so they may go about the more mundane aspects of their life without being mobbed by crowds.

subclassFeature.name: Choreo Flare: Star Struck
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Star Struck|TPDanc} flare, detailed below. It does not count against the number of flares you know

subclassFeature.name: Melodic Arts
entries: You are proficient with the Charisma ({@skill Performance}) skill and your singing voice, which you can use to make musical instrument tools checks. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any checks you make using these proficiencies.

subclassFeature.name: Stage Name
entries: You can add double your proficiency bonus to any checks you make using {@item disguise kit|PHB|disguise kits} and your singing voice.

Further, you create a secret identity which you can adopt or discard using a bonus action. Unless you tell a creature, or the creature sees you adopt or discard this identity, they do not know you and your secret identity are the same person.

subclassFeature.name: Commercial Success
entries: Stories of your must-see performances have spread far and wide, gaining you a bit of a fandom. When you make a Charisma check while interacting with a creature that respects your clout, be it by your true name or stage name, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Enrapturing Routine
entries: When a creature is charmed by your {@optfeature Star Struck|TPDanc} flare, you can choose to maintain the effect at the start of your subsequent turns with your bonus action.
Further, if the target of your {@optfeature Star Struck|TPDanc} flare is immune to being {@condition charmed}, it can be {@condition charmed} but instead makes the Wisdom saving throw with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Star-Studded Performance
entries: While you are maintaining your {@subclassFeature Enrapturing Routine|Dancer|TPDanc|Idolized Superstar|TPDanc|11}, the effects of any other flares you perform last while you maintain the performance. If a flare requires a saving throw to end its effects, an affected target can make the saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Noble Waltz
entries: Lavish parties among the aristocracy are essentially a rite of passage for members of nobility, as politics unfold in the ballroom as often as they do in the war room. Even if these dancers cannot claim the pedigree of noble birth, they are learned in the practices and pomp of patricians; be it from rubbing elbows with those of royal hierarchy or from instructing members of ruling families in this style. Masters of this choreo strive for nothing short of perfection in their every action, conducting themselves with a calculated tact and suave that allows them to navigate even the most treacherous of social environments as easily as they could a dance floor.

subclassFeature.name: Lap of Luxury
entries: Carousing counts as light activity for you for the purposes of resting. When you finish a long rest while maintaining an Aristocratic lifestyle, you regain all of your expended hit dice and can reduce your exhaustion level by 2, instead of 1. Your allies that carouse with you during the rest gain these benefits as well.

subclassFeature.name: The Sport of Kings
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item rapier|PHB|rapiers}. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you are weilding a rapier and you can see the attacker, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC against the attack, potentially causing the attack to miss.

subclassFeature.name: Choreo Flare: Ballroom Blitz
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Ballroom Blitz|TPDanc} dance flare, detailed below. It does not count against the number of flares you know.

subclassFeature.name: On My Authority
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Step Up|Dancer|TPDanc|2} feature, you can dictate a course of action. If the creature takes the stated course of action during the action you grant it with {@classFeature Step Up|Dancer|TPDanc|2}, the action's attack roll, ability check, or saving throw DC gains a bonus equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Subdue Transgression
entries: If a creature misses you with a melee weapon attack, you can immediately perform your {@optfeature Ballroom Blitz|TPDanc} flare. A target that previously won this contest is not immune to the effect when used this way.

subclassFeature.name: Regal Magnificence
entries: The duration of your {@optfeature Ballroom Blitz|TPDanc} flare becomes 1 minute, but you must use your bonus action on your turn to maintain the effect. An affected creature can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect early, and succeeding on the save counts as the creature having won the contest.

subclassFeature.name: Rallying Harbinger
entries: With bold, aggressive movements and chant-like, primal vocalizations, adepts of this choreo use their dances to invigorate and strengthen the resolve of their allies and to terrify and break the morale of their foes, both on and off the battlefield. These dancers can work the meekest of allied forces into fervorous frenzies and send fear sweeping through the lines of battle hardened enemy armies like flames through a field of dry wheat.

subclassFeature.name: Choreo Flare: Rallying Stomp
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Rallying Stomp|TPDanc} dance flare, which does not count against your number of flares known.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if something in the game lets you choose again.

subclassFeature.name: Herald of War
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill and with medium armor and shields.

subclassFeature.name: Call to Arms
entries: When you grant a creature an action with your {@classFeature Step Up|Dancer|TPDanc|2} feature and it uses the Attack action, it can make one additional attack with the given action.

subclassFeature.name: Oppressive Attrition
entries: You can use a bonus action to terrify your opposition. When you do so, choose one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature can see or hear you, you make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check contested by the target's Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check or Wisdom saving throw (their choice).

If you win the contest, the target is {@condition frightened} of you and your allies until the end of your next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a target's speed is halved. On subsequent turns, you can perform your {@optfeature Rallying Stomp|TPDanc} flare to extend the duration of this effect on the {@condition frightened} creature until the end of your next turn. The effect ends if the creature ends its turn out of line of sight or more than 60 feet away from you.
If you lose the contest, you can't frighten that creature again for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Flare of Frenzy
entries: Allies benefiting from your {@optfeature Rallying Stomp|TPDanc} flare can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action during their turns and, while you perform this flare, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Sylvan Mirth
entries: While almost all dancers are known to perform to music, none are as well known for the music they dance to as those of the choreo of Sylvan Mirth. Whether it's the dulcet melody of a set of pan-pipes, the lively ditty of a fiddle, or simply the metronomic clacking of a pair of spoons against their body, Dancers of this Choreo rarely dance without also providing their own musical accompaniment. Due to these styles coming primarily from the Spring and Summer Courts, this choreo is focused on expressions of joy, passion, and, of course, mischievousness.

subclassFeature.name: Choreo Flare: Hedonistic Revel
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Hedonistic Revel|TPDanc} dance flare, detailed below. It does not count against the number of flares you know.

subclassFeature.name: Paths Unseen
entries: While traveling in forests, both magical and nonmagical, you are always aware of your location approximate the forest's nearest border, the forest's overall health, and if there are any portals within the forest.

subclassFeature.name: Sylvan Arts
entries: You gain the {@spell dancing lights} and {@spell druidcraft} cantrips, and you learn to read, speak, and write Druidic and Sylvan.

subclassFeature.name: Pixie Tricks
entries: When you take the Disengage action, you can chose to either teleport up to your speed to any area you can see as if by the {@spell misty step} spell or turn {@condition invisible}, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, until the start of your next turn, or until you deal damage to a creature or force a creature to make a saving throw.
Once you turn {@condition invisible} with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Good Mischief
entries: Creatures that have immunity to your spells and effects that cause the {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} condition instead only have advantage on saving throws made against them.

Further, if a creature that is {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by you hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to magically cause the attack to miss, provided you can see the attacker.

subclassFeature.name: Wander the Wooded
entries: When you use the bonus action granted to you with {@subclassFeature Pixie Tricks|Dancer|TPDanc|Sylvan Mirth|TPDanc|6}, you can choose to grant the target of your Step Up feature the benefit as well.

subclassFeature.name: Thrashing Pit
entries: Originally developed by the destitute and dispossessed as a means of protesting the established rules both of dance and of society, Dancers of this choreo are typically referred to as 'hooligans.' To these Dancers, Thrash is not a Choreo one studies, but a way of life that one lives. Leading a comfortable life, one can never understand the true meaning of Thrash, for Thrash is real, Thrash is raw, Thrash is the struggle to survive against insurmountable odds.

entries.subclassFeature: If You Can't Take a Hit|Dancer|TPDanc|Thrashing Pit|TPDanc|3

subclassFeature.name: Choreo Flare: Mosh
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Mosh|TPDanc} dance flare, detailed below. It does not count against the number of flares you know.

subclassFeature.name: If You Can't Take a Hit
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 3 and increases by 1 whenever you gain a level in this class.
Additionally, when you reach 6th level in this class, yougain resistance to bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Throwing Elbows
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Intimidation} skills.
Further, you can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and {@skill Athletics} checks.

subclassFeature.name: Disrespect Your Surroundings
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Step Up|Dancer|TPDanc|2} feature or take the {@action Help} action, you and your target have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws, and deal double damage to objects and structures until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Killing in the Name
entries: Once during their turn, when your allies hit with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike while they are within 10 feet of you and you are not {@condition incapacitated}, they can roll 2d6 and add the result to the damage of the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Wall of Death
entries: As an action, you can scream a call to aggression to your allies. When you do, choose a number of creatures within 60 feet that can see or hear you equal to your Charisma modifier. A chosen creature can use their reaction to move up to half their speed and make a melee attack against a creature.You can do so as well as a part of this action.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Weave Teaser
entries: The somatic components of spells can be seen as a dance, as every careful movement must be rehearsed to tease the Weave and unleash its power. The techniques of the Weave Teaser developed alongside other arcane practices like Bladesinging, and practitioners of each are frequently found journeying together. Warping the Weave through movement alone is not a feat easily done, as it requires syncing one's body and mind to the rhythm of the very flow of magic itself.

entries.subclassFeature: Choreo Flare: Soma Fonta Arcana|Dancer|TPDanc|Weave Teaser|TPDanc|3

subclassFeature.name: Choreo Flare: Soma Fonta Arcana
entries: You gain the {@optfeature Soma Fonta Arcana|TPDanc} dance flare, detailed below. It does not count against the number of flares you know.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Dancer Lore
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@skill Arcana} skill and when you make an {@skill Arcana} check, you can make the check using Charisma instead of Intelligence.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the Player's Handbook for Spells Rules for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|PHB|11} for the {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn three cantrips of your choice from the {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer}. You learn an additional sorcerer cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Weave Teaser Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter sorcerer spells|spells|class=sorcerer} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell charm person} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell charm person} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level sorcerer spells of your choice, two of which you must choose from the abjuration and enchantment spells on the sorcerer spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Weave Teaser Spellcasting table shows when you learn more spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an abjuration or enchantment spell, and must be of a level no higher than the level shown in the Maximum Spell Level column of the Weave Teaser Spellcasting table. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.
The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from any school of magic.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the spells you know with another spell of your choice. The new spell must be an abjuration or evocation spell of a level no higher than the level indicated in the Maximum Spell Level Column, unless you're replacing the spell you gained at 3rd, 8th, 14th, or 20th level from any school of magic.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your spells, since the beauty of your dance teases the Weave and allows you to harness its magic. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Trip the Light Fantastic
entries: You can cast the {@spell feather fall} spell on yourself at will, without expending spell charges or spell slots.

Further, you can move along the outer area of spells with a defined area as if they were solid surfaces. You can move across the spell's area in any direction, including vertically, while leaving your hands free. If the spell is moved while you are moving on its surface, you move with the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Weaver's Counter
entries: When a creature targets you with a ranged spell attack, you can use your reaction to manipulate the essence of the spell. When you do, you contest the spell's attack roll with a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check.
If you win the contest, you gain control of the spell and you can make a ranged spell attack with the spell as a part of the same reaction as if you had cast it.

subclassFeature.name: Font Mystique
entries: When you finish a short rest, you can choose to regain all your spent spell slots. Once you do, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield or a simple or martial weapon to use this reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Ambient Arabesque
entries: This dance creates an aura which extends the nondamaging effects of any spell currently affecting you to all willing creatures of your choice while they are within 10 feet of you. The aura lasts until the start of your next turn, and never longer than the effect's stated duration.

optionalfeature.name: Artful Dodge
entries: Preparing yourself to gracefully react to those around you, you take the {@action Dodge} action. If you are targeted with an opportunity attack before the start of your next turn, the attack roll suffers a penalty equal to your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Bewildering Grace
entries: You toss caution to the wind performing this mysterious dance that briefly opens the wild potential of the universe. After you move, you roll a d20 and consult the Bewildering Grace table for the Effect that occurs. In order for a creature to be subjected to this flare's effects, it must be able to see you.
Performing this flare strains your body, giving you a level of {@condition exhaustion} after you perform it.

rows: A small, violent lightning storm controlled by the DM appears above you, as per the {@spell call lightning} spell. The storm lasts for 1 minute.
A {@filter fiend|bestiary|type=fiend} of CR no higher than your proficiency bonus (DM's choice) appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you. The fiend is controlled by the DM.
Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to the {@spell confusion} spell.
You shrink yourself as if by the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell.
{@dice 1d8} {@creature swarm of wasps||swarms of wasps} appear within 60 feet of you, controlled by the DM.
You become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn
Each creature within 60 feet of you, including yourself, must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to scream uncontrollably for the next minue.

Each creature within 30 feet of you, including you, must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transformed for 1 hour. This transformation causes a creature's feet to all become left versions of their feet, causing them to make Dexterity saving throws with disadvantage.

Each creature within 60 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature cannot regain hit points.
Music originates from a point of your choice within 60 feet for 1 hour. The music is audible out to a range of 300 feet.
Roll on this table at the start of your turn every round for 1 minute. Doing so does not give you additional levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

Each creature within 60 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends early if the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.
Each creature within 10 feet of you gain a flying speed of 60 feet for 1 hour.
{@dice 1d8} {@creature pixie|MM|pixies} appear within 60 feet of you
You enlarge yourself as if by the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell

Each enemy within 30 feet of you takes necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt. The necrotic damage dealt is equal to a number of d6s equal to your proficiency bonus.
A weapon of your choice within 60 feet of you begins to glow with holy power for 1 hour. On a hit, the weapon deals additional radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

Every creature of your choice within 60 feet of you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be turned into a {@filter beast of your choice of CR 1/2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/2]|type=beast|miscellaneous=!swarm} for 1 minute.
Allied creatures within 60 feet of you gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls until the end of your next turn equal to half your proficiency bonus (round down).

Allied creatures within 60 feet of you regain a number of hit points equal to your dancer level + your Charisma modifier, and any effect causing them to be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition poisoned}, or {@condition stunned} ends. If an ally in the area has died in the last minute, they return to life with these hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Bolstering Bolero
entries: You perform this enlivening spin, granting yourself and each ally within 5 feet of you temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Charisma modifier until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Cold Cut
entries: You can force a creature within 5 feet of you to make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check contested by the creature's Charisma ({@skill Performance}) or Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check (the target chooses the ability to use). If you win the contest, you push the target up to 5 feet away from you and can also knock it {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Electric Slide
entries: A shocking dance that supercharges the static energy nearby. Until the start of your next turn, you have resistance to lightning damage. Additionally, when you move during this turn, you leave behind a trail of arcing surgest of electricity when you move. Each 5-foot square area you move through becomes charged when you leave that space, and remains charged until the start of your next turn.

Creatures that enter a charged area for the first time on a turn or that starts its turn there must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} lightning damage, and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.
This flare's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Enrapturing Avant
entries: Choose a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you. The creature has disadvantage on any saving throws it makes against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Fallaway Reverse
entries: Until the start of your next turn, any creature that misses you with a melee attack falls {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Holistic Impetus
entries: Quickening a creature's natural healing, you spend one of your Hit Dice to allow any creatures within 5 feet of you that can see you to use their reaction to spend and roll one of their Hit Dice. Any creature that spends a Hit Die regains an amount of hit points equal to the result of the roll. If your hit points are fully restored and any hit points remain, the remainder is instead given to you as temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Goading Glissade
entries: This infuriating flare distracts those that would dare aggress against you. For the rest of the turn, any enemy you move within 5 feet of must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature has disadvantage on attack roll made against creatures other than you until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Ki Eclecticism
entries: A sacred dance of martial artists, which aligns oneself with the mystical energy of ki. When you perform this flare, any creature with the {@classFeature Ki|Monk|PHB|2} feature that sees your performance can use its reaction to spend one ki point and move up to a number of feet equal to its {@classFeature Unarmored Movement|Monk|PHB|2} bonus. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

Alternatively, if a creature that sees you give this performance has the {@subclassFeature Fighting Spirit|Fighter|PHB|Samurai|XGE|3} feature, it can use that feature as a reaction to you performing this flare.

optionalfeature.name: Mesmerizing Twist
entries: An enchanting dance of the fey that befuddles the minds of your audience. Upon performing the flare, you can force a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is confused as per the effects listed in the {@spell confusion} spell until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Moonwalk
entries: You walk backwards in a straight line up to 30 feet, illuminating the area you move through with silvery moonlight. Each 5-foot square you move through remains illuminated until the start of your next turn, shedding dim moonlight out to 5 feet.

Creatures that enter the area for the first time on a turn or that starts its turn there takes {@dice 1d6} radiant damage. A shapechanger instantly reverts to its original form and can't assume a different form until it leaves the area.
This flare's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Quick Change
entries: You instantly change out of and into any equipment you are proficient with in your inventory.

optionalfeature.name: Rising Windmill
entries: You perform a devastating spin, which you can finish off with a deft leap. All other creatures within 5 feet of you when you spin must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage. You can then leap up to an unoccupied area of your choice within half your Speed, which uses your Speed and ends the flare.
This flare's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Saber Dance
entries: As a part of this performance, you make an attack with a weapon that has the finesse property. If you score a critical hit with this attack, you can make an additional weapon attack, as part of the same action.

optionalfeature.name: Sensational Sway
entries: The performance of this inspirational dance acts as you taking the {@action Help} action, doing so allows you to aid an ally in attacking a creature if the target of the attack is within 30 feet of you while you move and if the ally can see you.

optionalfeature.name: Succor Chassé
entries: You target a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you. If the creature is under the effects that a successful saving throw can end, the creature can immediately attempt the saving throw to end the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Syllabus of Mimicry
entries: You open yourself up to suggestion through the somatic gestures of spells into a dance of mimicry, allowing you to bear the burden of their focus. If a willing creature within 60 feet of you performs the somatic components to cast a spell of 5th-level or lower before the start of your next turn, you can use your reaction to maintain concentration on the spell instead of the caster.

optionalfeature.name: Tango Flame
entries: Choose a creature within 15 feet of you. While the chosen creature is within 15 feet of you and either you or the creature can see the other, you both have resistance to fire damage and each of your attacks deal an extra {@dice 1d4} fire damage on a hit. These benefits last until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: The Hustle
entries: You target a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you. Until the start of your next turn, the creature gains an additional 10 feet of speed and it can use a bonus action on its turn to take the {@action Dash} action.

optionalfeature.name: Vision of the Muse
entries: Until the start of your next turn, if you or another creature gains a {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|PHB|1} die, you can use your reaction to give another creature that can see you within 60 feet a {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|PHB|1} die of the same size. Doing so does not subtract from the bard's uses of {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|PHB|1}.

optionalfeature.name: Wild Passion
entries: This flare inflames primal anger and fury. When you perform this flare, you can target a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you. If that creature has the {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1} or {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2} features, it can use the feature as a reaction, expending a use as detailed in the feature.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Mass Montero
entries: Rites and rituals are always made stronger through sacrificial dance. If a blood hunter uses their crimson rite before the start of your next turn, your current and maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to one roll of the blood hunter's hemocraft die while the rite is active, and heighten its power.
While the rite is active, attacks from the weapon affected by their crimson rite deal an additional {@dice 1d4} of the chosen rite's type.

optionalfeature.name: Ensorcelling Turn
entries: Developed amongst eldritch societies, this dance is a ritual that aids in the application of mystic marks. When you perform this flare, you can target a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you after you move. If that creature has the Mystic Mark feature, it can use its Aegis or Enspell action as a reaction, expending a use as detailed in the feature.

optionalfeature.name: Kamae Kabuki
entries: A display of supreme balance and harmony inspired by the sacred bushido code. Any ally that sees you give this performance that has either the Kamae or {@subclassFeature Fighting Spirit|Fighter|PHB|Samurai|XGE|3} features can use one of these features as a reaction to you performing this flare.

optionalfeature.name: Mana Majesticka
entries: Drawing forth the mana inherent to sculptors, you ease the burden of their shaping. A sculptor can use their Mana Shaper feature as a reaction to seeing you perform this flare.

optionalfeature.name: Ringside Swagger
entries: A flare born on the hard streets and back alleys, dancers that perform this flare are cheerleaders and hype-men to brawlers everywhere. When you perform this flare, you can target a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you after you move. If that creature has the Moxie feature, it can use an action that requires moxie points as a reaction, expending moxie points as detailed in the feature.

optionalfeature.name: Twist of Misfortune
entries: Pulling wisps of curse energy as ribbons around you, you extend the malignant influence of an ally bearing a curse. If you can see your ally using their Jinx feature while within 30 feet of you, you can perform this flare and touch a creature after you move, subjecting that creature to the effect as well.

optionalfeature.name: Uncorking the Bronco
entries: A dance of the wild frontier that shores up resolve, which evokes the storied power of grit. When you perform this flare, you can target a creature within 30 feet of you that can see you after you move. If that creature has a class feature that uses grit points and currently has fewer grit points than its maximum, you give them 1 grit point.

optionalfeature.name: Thriller
entries: This flare creates an undead dance partner. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within 10 feet of you. This flare raises it as an undead creature, becoming a {@creature skeleton} if you chose bones or a {@creature zombie} if you chose a corpse.

The raised undead only has a number of hit points equal to your Dancer level. You control any undead raised this way as if by the {@spell animate dead} spell for 24 hours, after which they fall lifelessly. You can also dismiss any undead animated this way as an action.
You can have one undead animated with this flare. Using this flare to animate undead beyond this number causes the previously animated undead to fall lifelessly.

optionalfeature.name: Star Struck
entries: You sing one of your big hits (or possibly one you were inspired to sing from another realm) while performing this flare. Choose a creature within 60 feet of you that can hear and see you. You make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check contested by a Wisdom saving throw by the chosen creature.

If you win the contest, the target becomes {@condition charmed} by you until the start of your next turn. While {@condition charmed} this way, it is being effectively {@condition blinded} when trying to observe anything other than you for the duration, or until you become {@condition incapacitated}.

If you lose the contest and when the effect ends, the target can't be {@condition charmed} by that person with this flare for 24 hours. For example, if you change your identity with {@subclassFeature Stage Name|Dancer|TPDanc|Idolized Superstar|TPDanc|3} after having failed to charm a target, the target could potentially be {@condition charmed} by this flare again.

optionalfeature.name: Ballroom Blitz
entries: You can choose a creature within 15 feet of you and issue a one-word command to it, as per the {@spell command} spell. You then make a Charisma (Intimidation or Persuasion, your choice) check contested by the target's Wisdom saving throw.
If you win the contest, the target must use its reaction to follow the issued command. If you lose the contest, the target is immune to this flare for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Rallying Stomp
entries: You remain in place until the start of your next turn while you perform this physical show of force. While you perform this flare, you cause the following effects:

items: While an ally is within 15 feet of you, the roll required for their weapon attacks to score a critical hit is reduced.
You reduce any nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage you take.

entries: The reduction listed for both of these benefits is equal to half of your proficiency bonus (round down).

optionalfeature.name: Hedonistic Revel
entries: While performing this flare, you choose one of the following magical effects: a charming melody, a frightening strain, or a gentle lullaby. You then choose one creature within 60 feet of you that can see or hear your performance. The chosen creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected as described below. Fey and creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} cannot be affected by this flare.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this flare for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Charming Melody
entries: It is {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute, or until you or any of your companions harm it.

entries.name: Frightening Cacophony
entries: It is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

entries.name: Gentle Lullaby
entries: t falls asleep and is {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, or until it takes damage or if someone takes an action to shake it awake.

optionalfeature.name: Mosh
entries: You can target a creature within your reach and try to {@action shove} it or help it stand up if it's {@condition prone}.
If you choose to {@action shove} it and win the contest, you can also make an unarmed strike against a creature within your reach before the {@action shove}.
If you choose to help it stand up, it gains advantage on the next attack roll or skill check it makes before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Soma Fonta Arcana
entries: You use the {@action Cast a Spell} action to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action. The remnants of your spell can be teased, allowing you to act as a conduit for your allies' magic. Until the start of your next turn, your allies within 60 feet of you that can see you can cast spells as if they had been cast from your position.
Once you perform this flare, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Body Linguist

prerequisite.other: Proficiency with both the Insight and Perception skills

entries: You can interpret the intentions of others by reading their posture and mannerisms, granting you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks when trying to determine a creature's attitude as either friendly, indifferent, or hostile if you can see it.

You can use a bonus action to unerringly convey a message silently using only physical gestures to other creatures that can see you. This message must be a simple concept, emotion, or one-word command.

feat.name: Bravo's Apprentice

prerequisite.other: Fighting Style feature, and no Dance Flares known

entries: You have studied the art of dance and developed martial techniques to convey this artistry. As a result, you learn one {@filter dance flare|optionalfeatures|feature type=DF|source=TPDanc} option of your choice from the dancer class. If the flare has a prerequisite of any kind, you can't choose it.

Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's {@filter dance flare|optionalfeatures|feature type=DF|source=TPDanc} with another one from the dancer class that you don't have.

feat.name: Fencer

prerequisite.other: Dueling Fighting Style and proficiency with either a rapier, scimitar, shortsword, or longsword

entries: Deft at defensive swordplay, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with {@skill Acrobatics} and can use a bonus action on your turn to make an {@skill Acrobatics} check.

When a creature you can see makes a weapon attack against you while you are wielding a {@item rapier|PHB}, {@item scimitar|PHB}, {@item shortsword|PHB}, or {@item longsword|PHB} and no other weapons, you can use your reaction to make an attack roll with your weapon. If your attack roll is higher than the triggering attack, that attack misses and your attack hits the creature if it is within your reach.

feat.name: Singer
entries: You are professionally trained or gifted as a vocalist, granting you the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with your voice, which you can use to make tools checks as a musical instrument.

spell.name: Corpselight
entries: You target either the corpse of a creature or an undead within range and illuminate it with a faint radiance of corpselight. This spell can affect multiple targets depending on their size. one Medium-sized corpse or Undead, two Small corpses or undead, or four Tiny corpses or undead. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

The target illuminates, shedding dim light in a 20-foot radius. If you have any corpses or undead illuminated with this spell, you can use your action to extinguish one of their corpselights, forcing each creature within 10 feet of the corpse or undead to succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage and {@dice 1d4} cold damage.

This spell's necrotic and cold damage each increase by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4} necrotic, {@dice 2d4} cold), 11th level ({@dice 3d4} necrotic, {@dice 3d4} cold), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4} necrotic, {@dice 4d4} cold).

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blade remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from its normal form.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The item is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Striking Beauty
entries: The weapon's attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity.

action.name: Strike
entries: {@atk mw} PB plus your DEX mod to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + PB} (bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing) damage.

trait.name: Break a Leg
entries: The dancer adds its proficiency bonus to its initiative rolls and can use a reaction to rolling initiative to grant an ally within 30 feet of it advantage on the first attack roll or ability check it makes before the end of its first turn.

trait.name: Dance Flares
entries: The dancer knows the following flares (Flare save {@dc 14}): {@optfeature Artful Dodge|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Electric Slide|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Fallaway Reverse|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Rising Windmill|TPDanc}

action.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

action.name: Step Up
entries: The dancer grants one of its allies an action, which it must take immediately. It can move up to half its speed before taking this action, and treats it as if it took the action on its turn.

trait.name: Break a Leg
entries: The dancer adds its proficiency bonus to its initiative rolls and can use a reaction to rolling initiative to grant an ally within 30 feet of it advantage on the first attack roll or ability check it makes before the end of its first turn.

trait.name: Dance Flares
entries: The dancer knows the following flares (Flare save {@dc 15}): {@optfeature Artful Dodge|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Bolstering Bolero|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Fallaway Reverse|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Rising Windmill|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Saber Dance|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Sensational Sway|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Tango Flame|TPDanc}

action.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6+4}) slashing damage. This attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 when used with {@optfeature Saber Dance|TPDanc}.

action.name: Step Up
entries: The dancer grants one of its allies an action, which it must take immediately. It can move up to half its speed before taking this action, and treats it as if it took the action on its turn.

bonus.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dancer can cast the following spells, using Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit):

trait.name: Break a Leg
entries: The dancer adds its proficiency bonus to its initiative rolls and can use a reaction to rolling initiative to grant an ally within 30 feet of it advantage on the first attack roll or ability check it makes before the end of its first turn.

trait.name: Dance Flares
entries: The dancer knows the following flares (Flare save {@dc 15}): {@optfeature Artful Dodge|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Bolstering Bolero|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Enrapturing Avant|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Fallaway Reverse|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Goading Glissade|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Mosh|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Sensational Sway|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Thriller|TPDanc}

trait.name: Grim Fandango
entries: Undead being controlled by this dancer gain a +3 bonus to their weapon damage rolls.

action.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

action.name: Step Up
entries: The dancer grants one of its allies an action, which it must take immediately. It can move up to half its speed before taking this action, and treats it as if it took the action on its turn.

bonus.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

trait.name: Break a Leg
entries: The dancer adds its proficiency bonus to its initiative rolls and can use a reaction to rolling initiative to grant an ally within 30 feet of it advantage on the first attack roll or ability check it makes before the end of its first turn.

trait.name: Dance Flares
entries: The dancer knows the following flares (Flare save {@dc 14}): {@optfeature Artful Dodge|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Bolstering Bolero|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Enrapturing Avant|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Fallaway Reverse|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Goading Glissade|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Rallying Stomp|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Sensational Sway|TPDanc}

trait.name: Call to Arms
entries: When the dancer uses its Step Up feature, the target can make one additional attack with the given action if it takes the Attack action.

action.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

action.name: Step Up
entries: The dancer grants one of its allies an action, which it must take immediately. It can move up to half its speed before taking this action, and treats it as if it took the action on its turn.

bonus.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

trait.name: Break a Leg
entries: The dancer adds its proficiency bonus to its initiative rolls and can use a reaction to rolling initiative to grant an ally within 30 feet of it advantage on the first attack roll or ability check it makes before the end of its first turn.

trait.name: Dance Flares
entries: The dancer knows the following flares (Flare save {@dc 14}): {@optfeature Artful Dodge|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Bolstering Bolero|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Enrapturing Avant|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Fallaway Reverse|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Goading Glissade|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Mosh|TPDanc}, {@optfeature Sensational Sway|TPDanc}

trait.name: Disrestpect Your Surroundings
entries: When the dancer uses Step Up or the Help action, the dancer and the ally it targets have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws, and deal double damage to objects and structures until the end of the dancer's next turn.

action.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Step Up
entries: The dancer grants one of its allies an action, which it must take immediately. It can move up to half its speed before taking this action, and treats it as if it took the action on its turn.

bonus.name: Dance
entries: The dancer performs one of the dance flares it knows.

entries.name: Dancer
entries: As a knight swings wide trying to strike the frothing maw of a displacer beast, a tiefling moves across the cave in a display of confidence and beauty. The mere sight of her invigorates the knight with an inner fire, who musters the strength to raise their sword up once more. The beast's deafening roar is silenced, as the blade is plunged deep past its fangs, seconds before those same fangs would have buried themselves within the knight's neck.

An archmage opens his flame-wreathed hands, sending bolts of fire directly towards the party. Interceding, a human guides the flames through the air, flinging them back at the archmage, giving him a taste of his own medicine.

Throwing all of his weight at the bandits, a dwarf slams against the leader and hurls them into a wall while bringing his elbow up into the gut of a subordinate, pummeling them both with a brutish fluidity and grace.

Preservers and pioneers of dance traditions, dancers are practitioners of the alluring and, at times, distracting art of dance. They have a remarkable flair for drawing the attention of others, allowing these awe-inspiring muses to turn the tide of any engagement.

entries.name: Baskers of Limelight
entries: Anything created that elicits an emotional response can be considered art. Writers pen the story, musicians compose the song, painters color the landscape, but dancers simply dance. It is the only art form in which the performer is the entirety of the artistic medium, putting themselves on display for their passion. They are mavens of distraction, for no person is truly more at-home as the center of attention than a dancer.
Captivating their audience with their enthusiasm, grace, and force of personality, dancers use dazzling flares on the battlefield to support their allies, and distract their foes.

entries.name: Flair and Panache
entries: Drawing the comparison between a bard and a dancer is inevitable; but the two are compliments, not competitors. While bards actualize their magic by performing or reciting tones of power, the dancer uses beautiful dance flares to externalize and influence emotion. The two work separately, yet cohesively, for a bard's music decorates time and the Dancer's beauty decorates space. Anyone can dance, but few can claim to have gone through the practice, study, then application of this art form that makes one a dancer.

entries.name: Playing a Dancer
entries: The dancer is a medium defense, low damage and high support through optimizing your party's action economy. In combat, you should look out for party members that have limited duration effects, use unique class resources, or are in an advantageous position to exploit the enemy.
Action: Step Up or preform a Dance Flare
Bonus Action: Disengage or perform a Dance Flare
Movement: Safe distance from the enemy, but within your allies' vision.
Reaction: Class features, or trigger for Ready action.

entries.name: Creating a Dancer
entries: To create a dancer, consult the following subsections, which give you hit points, proficiencies, and starting equipment. Then look at the Dancer table to see which features you get at each level. Your Proficiency Bonus is shown in the PB column. The descriptions of those features appear in the "Class Features" section.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a dancer quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Dexterity, followed by Charisma then Constitution. Second, choose the {@background entertainer} background.
